sub_title: Clinical chemist in training at CWZ/Radboudumc
summary: I am an enthusiastic scientist and I aspire to have a significant impact on improving the understanding of our immune system and improving the efficacy of cancer immunotherapy. To this end, I work in the interdisciplinary field of immunoengineering. I really enjoy working at this interface, meeting new challenges and working with many different people. In my projects, I am assertive and detail-oriented, with excellent presentation and communication skills.

education.field_of_study: Classic and Modern Methods for Molecular Diagnostics in Human Pathology

awards.title: Niels Stensen Fellowship grant 2019
awards.description: 1 year personal research grant to obtain postdoctoral research experience at EPFL, Lausanne, Switzerland

awards.title: Best Poster Award at the Gordon Research Conference: Cancer Nanotechnology
awards.description: I was awarded the Best Poster Award for my poster presentation entitled: "Polyisocyanopeptide polymers as versatile tools for efficient T cell expansion and delivery" at the Gordon Research Conference: Cancer Nanotechnology in Vermont, USA.

awards.title: Best oral presentation PhD retreat 2018
awards.issuer: Radboud Insitute for Molecular Life Sciences

awards.title: Christine Mohrmann Stipendium
awards.description: Award for promising female PhD candidates at the Radboud University in Nijmegen to facilitate a work visit abroad

awards.title: ENABLE travel grant
awards.description: I received a travel grant to attend the 1st European PhD and Postdoc symposium in Barcelona hosted by the ENABLE network.

awards.title: Third place in 3-minute thesis competition
awards.description: Competition where PhD students present their research to the general public in three minutes, Northeastern University, Boston, USA

awards.title: Radboud University Travel grant
awards.description: I received a Radboud University Travel grant for outgoing PhD candidates for a work visit as a visiting research scholar at Northeastern University, Boston, USA.

awards.title: NVVI Travel grant
awards.description: I received a travel grant from the Dutch Society of Immunology to attend the BSI/NVVI Annual Congress 2016 in Liverpool.

awards.title: Radboud Intemationalisation grant
awards.description: Me and my co-organizers received the Radboud Internationalisation Grant as a financial support for organization of the symposium 'Hacking the immune system: exploiting computational immunology to understand the immune system'.

awards.title: Best Poster Award at the Oxford Chemical Immunology Conference 2016
awards.description: I was awarded the Best Poster Award for my poster presentation entitled: "Synthetic immune niches: a tool for modulation and interrogation of the anti-tumour immune response" at the Oxford Chemical Immunology Conference 2016 in Oxford, UK.
awards.issuer: The Molecular Immunology group, the British Society for Immunology

awards.title: Radboud University Travel Grant
awards.description: I received a Radboud University Travel grant for outgoing PhD candidates to attend the Oxford Chemical Immunology Conference 2016 in Oxford, UK.

awards.title: Erasmus Intensive Life Long Learning Programme Grant
awards.description: I received a grant from the Erasmus Intensive Life Long Learning Programme to attend a two-week course on human pathology in Brasov, Romania.

awards.title: Erasmus Life Long Learning Grant
awards.description: I received an Erasmus Life Long Learning Grant for my internship at Leukaemia Research Cytogenetics Groups in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, UK.

awards.title: KWF student grant
awards.description: I received a KWF student grant from the Dutch Cancer Society for my internship at Leukaemia Research Cytogenetics Groups in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, UK.

projects.title: Organization of international symposium: Hacking the immune system; Exploiting computational immunology to under-stand the immune system
projects.description: Together with three fellow PhD students I co-organized a symposium on computational immunology and artificial immune systems. This one-day symposium brings together national and international experts in the field of tumor immunology, computational modelling and artificial immune systems to discuss the most recent developments in this interdisciplinary field. My responsibilities were invitation of and contact with the invited speakers, promotion and budgeting.

profile_positions.title: Clinical chemist in training (AIOS klinische chemie)
Coordinator of the Communication working group

profile_positions.description: I was a postdoctoral fellow at EPFL funded by a Niels Stensen fellowship. I am part of the lab of Prof. Maartje Bastings and work on designing DNA origami for immunoengineering purposes.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher (Niels Stensen fellow)

profile_positions.description: eLife Ambassadors constitute a group of early career scientists around the world who create and disseminate solutions that accelerate positive changes within academia. Initiatives that I am involvd in: public involvement and diversity in science
profile_positions.title: eLife ambassador for Early Career Researchers

profile_positions.description: Research in the lab of Prof. Carl Figdor into the development of new strategies for cancer immunotherapy, focused on immunoengineering of smart three-dimensional biomaterials that allow for controlled immunomodulation of tumor-specific T cells.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Research in the lab of Prof. Carl Figdor into the development of new strategies for cancer immunotherapy, focused on  immunoengineering of smart three-dimensional biomaterials that allow for controlled immunomodulation of tumor-specific T cells.
Thesis: Synthetic immune niches for localized cancer therapy. Defense: 31st of Jan, 2020
profile_positions.title: PhD Student at the Tumor Immunology Lab

profile_positions.description:
Visiting research scholar in the lab of Prof. Bencherif at the Department of Chemical Engineering in order to gain experience in scaffold fabrication and characterization
August-September 2017, June-August 2018
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Scholar

profile_positions.description: President and founder of the patho-committee, a student committee that organizes various seminars (both on science topics and career opportunities) and activities for students of the Master Biomedical Sciences at the Radboud University
profile_positions.title: President and founder of the patho-committee

profile_positions.location: Department of Tumor Immunology, Nijmegen, the Netherlands
profile_positions.company: Radboud Institute for Molecular Life Sciences (RIMLS)
profile_positions.description: In my final master's intership I studied the expression and function of the immune suppressive enzyme IDO in human circulating dendritic cell subsets, with relation to its implications for the development of cancer immunotherapy.
profile_positions.title: Master's student internship

profile_positions.description: I studied the effect of neutrophils on breast cancer dissemination in a preclinical model of invasive lobular breast cancer metastasis and the underlying immunosuppressive mechanisms in this process.  .
profile_positions.title: Master's student internship

profile_positions.location: Leukaemia Research Cytogenetics Group, Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom
profile_positions.description: During this 5 month internship my research focused on the identification and genetic charactization of a novel cytogenetic subgroup in B-cell precursor acute lymphoblastic leukaemia
profile_positions.title: Student internship
